context.description: TCPIPServerReceive node Use the TCPIPServerReceive node to receive data over a server TCP/IP connection.
Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Basic page Enter the host name, port number and timeout information for the TCPIPServerReceive node.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Advanced page Enter advanced configuration information for the TCPIPServerReceive node: for example, whether the TCP/IP connection is closed after a record is received.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Request page Enter the location in the message tree of the request data, host name and port number for the TCPIPServerReceive node.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Result page Enter the location in the message tree where the result data is placed by the TCPIPServerReceive node.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Input Message Parsing page Set values for the properties that the node uses to determine how to parse the incoming message.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Parsing Options page Edit the timing properties on this page to control when and how messages are parsed and validated. Select one of the XMLNSC options.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node
Specifying opaque elements for the XMLNSC parser

context.description: Records and Elements page Specify how and to what extent you want your TCPIP records and elements to be processed.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node

context.description: Validation page Set these properties if you want the MRM parser to validate the body of messages using the dictionary generated from the message set, and choose the failure action to be taken.

topic.label: TCPIPServerReceive node - Configuring the TCPIPServerReceive node
